text:
Hi Iram. 
Sorry, I've not been ignoring you. Month ends + exams meant time eluded me.

I never applied to university. I mean, I filled a UCAS form, as we were forced to. But I didn't actually submit it. Mainly because I didn't know what I wanted to do so submitting a write up on a area which i was only semi-interested In wouldnt have been the best idea. 
One thing I noticed whilst I started applying 3/4 years ago was apprenticeships were sort of looked down upon by teachers. 
I'm surprised that notion still exists. 
I guess it won't be a harm to write up a essay (or whatever is required) as you can get it marked (sort of) and use that as a guidance for when applying for apprenticeships. As the questions will sometimes be similar- ish.
